meanings.definition: In a state of having little or no money.
meanings.sent1: The impecuniously man struggled to pay his bills.
meanings.sent2: She lived an impecuniously simple life, never spending more than necessary.
meanings.sent3: Despite being impecuniously broke, he always found joy in the little things.
meanings.sent4: The impecuniously artist painted with passion, using only what he could afford.
meanings.sent5: The impecuniously student saved every penny for a brighter future.

meanings.sent1: The impecuniously family relied on community support to survive.
meanings.sent2: Living impecuniously, she learned to appreciate the value of every cent.
meanings.sent3: The impecuniously traveler found creative ways to fund his adventures.
meanings.sent4: The impecuniously entrepreneur built her business from the ground up.
meanings.sent5: Despite being impecuniously poor, he was rich in kindness and generosity.
